CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 19, 1952, pg. 19, reads: "Overlooked By Investigators - in fist [first] two pictures, from left to right, are views of Eighth Avenue, Homestead, looking east and west from Amity Street. This is a shopping center for Homestead, West Homestead, Munhall, West Mifflin, Whittaker, Thirty-first Ward, Pittsburgh, Glen Hazel Projects and the lower part of Forward Avenue, down to Second Avenue. On the extreme right is a view of Sixth Avenue, only thoroughfare in Homestead, charged with racket operations.  Fourteen of the seventeen dwellings are occupied by people who own them, and who have resided in Homestead for thirty years or more.  What probers say took place on the 600 feet of pavement, caused a State Special Grand Jury, in 1951, blacken the reputation of the little steel borough and recommend indictment of Burgess John J. McLean, his Police Chief, Thomas (Muck) Conlin, and others. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Eighth Avenue at night, with Christmas lights, signs for Route 837, and greeting card store, Homestead
